dialogues.speaker: A PAIR OF HANDS
dialogues.text: men's hands, nicely groomed, hold a small white terry towel spoiled by blood-red spots. The hands rinse the towel in a copper bar sink. The stains soften but stay. A tan jacket sleeve, spotted the same way, moves INTO FRAM. The hands dab the wet towel at the spots, with no more success, and throw it into the sink. It falls half in, still dripping the stains a drop at a time to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The owner of the hands walks to a wine rack, opens a bottle of white wine, drizzles the wine on the jacket sleeve. The stains disappear. He hangs his jacket on a hook and walks from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and up the narrow stairs. His FOOTFALLS ECHO against the unadorned cement block walls. We see his shape, mid- forties, powerful, his shirt pulled out. He's carrying the open bottle by the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still seen from behind, the man emerges from the cellar into a contrastingly elegant space with a wood-beamed. ceiling, vaguely European. He walks along a narrow aisle of wooden diamond bins. As the space widens his foot hits something in his path. He bends to find a shoe. He glances about nervously. There are shutters on the storefront windows. Shoe in hand, he tightens the shutters. We see his profile, a good-looking man. He walks toward a brighter room at the back of the store, the Tasting Room. Now he retrieves a pair of women's trousers from the floor, and as he straightens up we see his entire face, genial, venial, redeemed by his smile. ALEX GATES. He speaks nonchalantly toward the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty people tonight. I got a South Beach widow, a plastic surgeon -- they actually came together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people -- all they really want is something to brag about at dinner parties. He swigs from the bottle of white wine, grimaces, detours behind the counter, and spits the mouthful into the plastic lined wastebasket. He throws the bottle away.
2 2 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a basket of baguettes on the counter. Alex breaks off an end and chews it to rid his mouth of the taste of the wine. Still chewing, he walks toward the tasting room. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There I was, passing the wine, passing the bread, I suddenly felt like the priest at Masst Or maybe Mass started out as a wine tasting, and Jesus was a salesman. what do you think? He goes into

dialogues.speaker: THE TASTING ROOM
dialogues.text: It seems empty except for a large wooden table, folding chairs in disarray, open bottles clustered at one end of the table. A chalkboard on the wall has CHATEAU BEYCHEVELLE written across it at the top, vintages listed underneath. The woman's voice that replies is Gabriella's.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIELLA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (with a throaty laugh) Maybe I should get dressed. Leaning against the corner is a woman wearing only her panties and a shirt. In her mid-twenties she has striking South American looks. GABRIELLA VASQUEZ. She's sipping red wine from a plastic glass. GABRIETM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to spoil a religious experience. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Ever heard of Georges Duboeuf? He throws away some of the glasses. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duboeuf has a nose and a palate -- like a gift from God. He can taste a single grape before the harvest... and describe the beaujolais it's going to produce. She laughs. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you have competition. (CONTINUED)
2 2 CONTINUED: (2) ALEX (SLIGHTLY ANNOYED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how many bottles I have in this store? Open any one of 'em, I'll tell you the vintage and vintner, b lindfolded. He bends down to pick up the chunks of baguette strewn on the floor. He doesn't see her slip off her panties. She walks behind him, twirling them into a tight band. She whips them over his eyes. He laughs. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Show me. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria's Secret 95. She passes her glass under his nose. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella, I picked these wines. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is it? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I can smell is your perfume. She laughs. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not wearing any. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I even bought it for you. She opens her shirt. She's not wearing a bra. She lowers her breast to the glass and then to his mouth. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me now. He kisses her wet breast. ALEX (WITHOUT HESITATION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beychevelle '83. Lot of body. Very aggressive. He pulls off the panty blindfold, kisses her on the mouth softly, then fully. (CONTINUED)
2 2 CONTINUED: (3) GABRIELLA (LOW)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I lo e y u, Alex. V O 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is unlocking the door for Gabriella. Dressed, she looks younger. They're awkward with each other. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think you have to say it because .1 say it, Alex. (SMILING BRIGHTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't mean anything.. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means something to me. GABRIELLA (EASED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're good together, aren't we. Alex lets out a breath. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah... We're pretty good. He kisses her goodbye, unlocks the door. She goes out to her Honda Civic. Alex doesn't wait to see her drive off before he heads back to finish cleaning up the tasting room. 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex straightens the last chair and starts to extract air from the open bottles. He hears a quiet CLANK of METAL. Instantly alert, he reaches for his jacket and turns off the-light. 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the cash register Alex opens a drawer and takes ou a revolver. ze thumbs the safety off. The NOISES RECUR, like someone trying to break in through the back door fro the parking lot. Alex slings his jacket casually over the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex throws open the back door; he's counting on the element of surprise. HIS POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His red Cadillac convertible is idling nose.to the chain locked across the parking lot. A MAN in his twenties, whose tropical shirt fairly glows under the security lights, is using a pair of bolt cutters on the chain. ALEX (ADVANCING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're gonna steal my car, asshole? The younger man whirls around. YOUNG MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared me, man. A middle-aged man, a REPO MAN, calls out lazily from behind the wheel. REPO MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not your car, sir. This car belongs to the Star Leasing Company. Alex buries the gun in the rear of his waistband as thoug he's rubbing his stiff back and cranks his smile to a higher wattage than the security lights. REPO MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can collect either the money or the car. Given how much you owe, I figure it's the car. The younger man has almost hacked through the chain. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop the. trunk. REPO MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We inventory the property at the yard. He keeps his eye on the chain, ready to gun the engine as soon as the exit is clear. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to show you something. Worked by the combination of natural curiosity and Alex's charm; the repo man pops the trunk and gets out of the still-running car. (CONTINUED)
6 6 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his hand he has the locking "Club" Alex usually uses t secure his. steering wheel. He's not stupid. Amused, Alex takes a step back, palms up. YOUNG MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? The repo man ignores him and looks in the trunk. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you drink? REPO MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on the job. What is this, booze? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cases of single malt whiskey aged in the barrel before he was born. REPO MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddy's overdue. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you. Drink it with the kid. Teach him what smooth is. Enjoy yourselves. Isn't that worth a few days' breather... (A BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My accountant's a fuck-up. So am I, maybe, for not firing him. The bolt cutters clip through. The chain falls. YOUNG MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're clear. 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is driving fast, top down, Samba MUSIC loud on the STEREO. He keeps time on the wheel as the Miami skyline cruises by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex turns into the garage of an expensive condominium building before the gate has slid all the way open. The TIRES SQUEAL as he powers the car around the corner. (CONTINUED)
8 8 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: A DUCATI MOTORCYCLE
dialogues.text: hogs his space. Alex lays the car in tightly. He has to squeeze out the door. He bumps the Ducati. It starts to topple; he grabs it before it goes over. 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex lets himself in. The entry ALARM starts to BEEP. He turns it off and resets it. The light has been left on in the kitchen. 10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASON, a handsome, troubled 17-year-old with long, dark hair, is filing barbs off a pile of fishing hooks on the center island. He looks harder and wiser than his years. Tackle is strewn everywhere. Some spaghetti remains in the pot it was cooked in and Jason's knife is standing upright in it. Alex walks into the kitchen. He makes an effort to be pleasant, although he's irritated by the mess, by the motorcycle. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late, Jason. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going out tonight. Alex exhales. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't'fish all night and work all day. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working for you doesn't exactly tax my mind. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder you drop bottles. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire me. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you do it on purpose? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fishing bought me my bike. (CONTINUED)
10 10 CONTINUED: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost knocked it over trying to get out of the car. JASON (SARCASTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't sure you were coming home. SEVERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TOASTER OVEN DINGS. Jason takes out a muffin, it in two with his fishing knife. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use a regular knife. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has a better edge. Feel it (pointing it at Alex, BLADE FLAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- feel it. Their voices are rising. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pointed, it's a fucking weapon. Put it away. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell with you. Jason exits to the stairs. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And keep your voice down. Your mother's asleep. STAIRS JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you got home on time once in a while, maybe she could skip the chemical help. Alex is also on the stairs. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea, none, zip, what goes on in a marriage. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm learning more than I want to. (CONTINUED)'
10 10 CONTINUED: (2) LANDING UPSTAIRS

dialogues.speaker: SUZANNE
dialogues.text: Now what are you arguing about? SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is a pretty young woman in her late thirties with a sense of humor and irony. She's chemically relaxed, but not stupefied. She pulls a robe around herself, modest in front of her son; and although her body's not spectacular like Gabriella's, she has a trim. athletic build. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not an argument. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked him to clean up downstairs. SUZANNE (SOOTHING ALEX)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he hadn't finished- ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modicum of cooperation, you know? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modicum. What's that. Modicum my ass. He pushes past his mother toward his own room. Suzanne follows him down the hallway, leaving. Alex behind. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like that tone from: you. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go to bed. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! JASON (RIGHT BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late for this. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason has gone into his room. He slams the door. CHOOSES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: enters his bedroom. Suzanne, alone for a-moment, to enter Jason's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my husband. JASON (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Mom. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I still love him. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. She walks out. 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex stands under water as hot as he can stand, parboilin himself. Eyes squeezed shut, he lets out a long breath. His life demands more energy than he has anymore. He soaps himself thoroughly. 13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne hears the front DOOR SLAM. Jason's DUCATI STARTS UP and ACCELERATES away. Alex comes out of the bathroom in a towel. SUZANNE (FONDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie down, I'll give you a back rub. She stumbles slightly against the bed, catches a bed post for balance, flops back on the bed with a laugh. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- maybe I'd better lie down. He bends down to kiss her, then heads for the television. Suzanne props herself up on her elbows. He pops a cassette into the VCR: porno, she assumes. She does her best. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked the twin nurses. There was kind of a story. Alex brings the remote control back to bed. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll like this one better. (CONTINUED)
13 13 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs his towel on a doorknob, slides into bed, starts the tape, which begins with sweat-slick dancing girls at Carnival. To Suzanne's astonishment, it turns out to be a travelog. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rio? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been so busy. We could sneak away for a week.. Would you like that? SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we really go. Last time I packed, we went nowhere. ALEX (SLEEPILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time was different. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching the tape) The beaches -- I thought we had a beach. I read how the hotels keep spotters on the roof with scopes, to keep thieves away from the guests. They can look at every inch of your body through the scope. (with a low laugh) Do you mind that I like that? Alex? He has fallen asleep. Tenderly she draws the sheet to his shoulder and settles down to watch the rest of the tape. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the flying bridge of an old fishing boat, Jason eases the throttle to idle speed. The engine quiets down. The SWELLS SLAP harder against the wooden sides. The boat dips and dances to the music of the water. Jason swings down the ladder. He sets up his linis to troll. The starry dome of the sky is starting to brighten around its rim. Jason leans on the transom and stares at the flat, silvery wedge of wake. He breathes out a word. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: :. Bite... (CONTINUED)
14 14 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happens. He doesn't move. Then the top of one of the rods shivers slightly, goes still. Jason delicately fingers the rod like a blind man reading Braille, to feel for vibration. A smile pulls at his mouth. He steps behind the rod. The fish hits. JASON (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henryl Fish ont The line screams out. Jason's ready. He sets the hook. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go to work, man! C'mon. A tall, black drifter appears from-below, still yawning, scratching. HENRY, 33. He wears a red Panama hat that's weathered his head for some time. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who we got? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's find out. He hauls back on the rod, the line rises from the ocean, they both recognize the fish at the end. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking sharks. Miami's fished out of the good stuff. Damn. He spits over the side. Jason grins. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's got more to worry about than you do. He starts to reel in the fish. Henry moves to the wheel.- HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shoot 'Jaws' in the water. I want to know the sucker's good and dead 'fore he sets a fin in my boat. You got a barb on that hook? . JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Jason braces for the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Henry are cutting the shark with the speed and dexterity of professionals. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gulf, man, that's the place. And what makes you think fifty-fifty is right? My boat. My gas. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My skill. (slicing off the fins) ... My fins. 16

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: Jason and Henry slap their catch onto the Fishmonger's slippery counter. The market's noisy, men shouting. We see the negotiation from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Henry walk through the hubbub. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cool? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cool. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cool. Jason guns his Ducati.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex comes out of his office. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob, has Jason shown up? A man's French-accented VOICE answers him from the store.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Not yet. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have his paycheck there? ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All ready. (CONTINUED)
18 18 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex takes it, and rips it up. 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinese CHEF in the busy, steamy kitchen is inspectin the shark fins Jason has brought him. Jason is anxious to finish business and go. CHEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You no like my company? Fine. Who cares. Bring me more fin, you retire. You no want to retire? Good. Don't charge starving Chinese so much for these things. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever caught a shark? CHEF (BIGGER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever cook one? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme -- lemme show you something. Jason pulls up the sleeve of his denim jacket to display a fresh gash across his arm. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was already gaffed onto the side of the boat, good as dead. Two hours dead! And I was still too close to the mouth. Revenge is the last instinct to go, did you know that? The chef shrugs and shows his thumb, missing a joint. CHEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Work's a dangerous thing. (smiling with lots of TEETH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice fin, Jason. He tosses the fins in a cauldron of boiling water, slaps the CASH REGISTER on the side. It RINGS. 20

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason jams on his helmet and starts his. motorcycle, guns it down the street. (CONTINUED)
20 20 CONTINUED: MIAMI SKYLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason weaves through traffic, expert enough to take chances that goose the adrenalin. 21

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert and Alex are loading cases of wine into the trunk of the Caddy when Jason skids into the parking lot. He takes off his helmet. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get in the car. 22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason has fallen asleep while Alex drives. Alex picks up Jason's hand. Jerking awake, Jason tries to pull away, but his reflexes are sleep-slowed. Alex sniffs Jason's fingers, wrinkles his nose, lets Jason have his hand back ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stink. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I washed. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Wash IN Dries in the glove compartment. Jason opens the compartment, finds the packets, opens one rubs his hands. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm trying here, Jason -- I really am. When you didn't want to go to college, I took your side, I said fine -- I mean, I -didn't finish college, and I've done all right. I gave you a job', a steady check, which is more than anybody else has done. And what do I get back? Shit. I've tried to teach you the business -- the care, the finesse... Jason laughs dismissively. (CONTINUED)
22 22 CONTINUED: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look at it this way, Jason, someday you'll have your boat and I'll have my vineyard, and the best part '11 be they're nowhere near each other. JASON (SATISFIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send you a Christmas card. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save the stamp. They turn into the driveway to an expensive development. 23

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac rolls to a stop at the ate. A tough, but amicable-looking armed guard in his forties, MIKE, opens the window of the air-conditioned booth. His RADIO is tuned to the FOOTBALL GAME. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, mike -- what's the score? MIKE (CHECKING THE APPOINTMENT BOARD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolphins down by nine, minute forty to go. It's over. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't underestimate Marino. Mike ticks off the appointment, raises the gate. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, they don't have it this year. With a wave of acknowledgment for Mike, Alex.. drives ont the grounds. ALEX (YELLING BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ГўВЂВў Judas! Grinning, Mike routinely writes down the license plate number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex cruises past a collection of oversized villas, and turns into the driveway of the gaudiest. He and Jason climb out of the car. Alex opens the trunk. He loads two wine cases into Jason's arms, takes the third himself. They haven't said a word to each other. 25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex rings the intercom with his elbow. Gabriella's VOICE CRACKLES in response.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIELLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: on the intercom) Who is it? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wine delivery. The INTERCOM CLICKS off. They hear FOOTSTEPS approaching. The door opens. Jason's eyes focus. He's hooked. Gabriella is smiling at Alex. She has her arms full of clean burp cloths. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the boss himself! ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a modest chuckle) How are you? She glances politely toward Jason, not at all expecting what she sees. A circuit connects between them. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella takes care of Baby Reese. (TO GABRIELLA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my stepson, Jason. GABRIELLA (VERY CORRECT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the wine for the boat? Come through the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They follow her inside. Jason takes in the richness of the place, but is more focussed on Gabriella. They exit TO T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he lawn which leads to a dock. 27

dialogues.speaker: EXT. REESES' BOAT DAY
dialogues.text: A sleek, ocean-going yacht is tied up at the dock, the crew unobtrusively at work. FRANK REESE, a powerful, confidant man in his mid-sixties, is sitting with his INSURANCE AGENT at a table on deck where policies are spread out next to a jewelry box. Reese's expensive 35- year-old wife DINA has turned her chair to sun her legs while she plays with the BABY. DINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what's the point of having it, if I can't wear it, Frank? AGENT (DEFERENTIALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can wear it anywhere you like, Mrs. Reese -- except out of the country. Gabriella leads Alex and Jason aboard. Frank likes Alex and is glad to see him. Alex can't help glancing at Dina's long legs.. She smiles. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, should we insure the wine while we're at it? His arms tired,'Alex is happy to set down the case. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you covered on your home policy? GABRIELLA (TO JASON)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you, come on. AGENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much wine are we talking about? Jason follows Gabriella down below, the VOICES on the dec fading.

dialogues.speaker: DINA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Why bother insuring it? Let's drink it instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet inside, not tasteful but impressive, like everything else of the Reeses. Jason takes a stab at conversation. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big boat. Gabriella laughs and looks over her shoulder at him. They're both kids. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ugly, isn't it. He grins and relaxes, looks around. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fittings are definitely -- yeah on the ugly side. But damn, she's solid. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, a boat type. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud, defensive) I like.boats. Gabriella shows him the climatized, built-in wine closet next to the galley. He starts to rack the bottles while she watches. He talks to stop her from leaving. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where you headed? GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going, 'I can't go. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't want to take the baby. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IГўВЂВўdon't have a green card, I can't leave the country. Baby goes with an American nurse. I house-sit. It's fine. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like them. Gabriella laughs. (CONTINUED)
28 28 CONTINUED: GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. I'm obvious. I just don't like working for people, but that's life. He chafes under authority the same way she does. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't have to be. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not with a rich stepfather. He laughs. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worst kind. GABRIELLA (CORRECTIVELY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (A BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't appreciate what you have, Jason. It's very poor where I came from. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that? GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venezuela. Do I look it? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I never been there. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't. My mother's Indian. The India kind of Indian. (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine a house where the father asks 'What's for dinner' in Spanish, and the mother answers 'Curry' in Hindi. 'Que hay para cenar' she says, 'Murgee, masala, ghaal.' He says, 'No es importante.' No wonder I'm nuts. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem too nuts. She laughs. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know mel (OOR1TINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They're suddenly both very aware that they're alone together. 29

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent is putting a magnificent diamond necklace in a velvet pouch that he fastidiously cinches and ties. Alex looks away from it to take a bottle out of the remaining case on deck. AGENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- so back to the safe it goes -- Dina lifts up the baby and smells its bottom. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dina, that's disgusting. DINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alternative is using your fingers, Frank. which offends you more? Alex laughs. Frank pushes back his chair. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't encourage her, Alex. Her mouth is big enough. Dina is hurt. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the agent) I'll show you that painting in our stateroom. The agent follows him away. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kindly; to Dina) Do you want to see the label? She hides her hurt by not looking at him. DINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just open the bottle, Alex. Pour us both a glass. I'm not allowed to drink alone. When she turns her head and looks at him, she's flirting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason has almost finished storing the wine. Gabriella is sitting on a bar stool at the galley,. listening to him, snared by the quiet passion in his voice. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- when you're skimming along the water, nothing between you and the bottom of the sea but a layer of wood, your thoughts... end. All that noise inside your head? Gabriella nods, understanding exactly. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . . . Stops. Dina's VOICE booms over the INTERCOM, startling both of them. The BABY is FUSSING. Gabriella makes a gesture of apology to Jason.

dialogues.speaker: DINA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Gabriella? Are you down there? GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mrs. Reese.

dialogues.speaker: DINA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The baby needs you. And bring a pacifier for Frank. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there. She slides off the stool. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should come out with me sometime. She smiles without answering and goes topside. His eyes follow her. A Deckhand comes down the ladder with the remaining case of wine for him to stock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella. lifts the fussy baby from Dina, her hands sure and calming. She coos nonsense to his little ear as she- reaches for the diaper bag and slings it over her arm. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He.'s ready for his nap. (CONTINUED)
31 31 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and the agent return from another section of the boat. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You doing up to the house, Gabriella? (off her nod) Want to take this with you? He sweeps the policies into a large manila envelope, drop the 'pouch in with them, ties the string, hands it to her FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on my desk. He looks at his wife with her glass, Alex with his glass, and doesn't like it. His voice hardens slightly. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we all set, Alex? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to check the storage room, see what else'll travel. I know I put some vintage Armagnac in there, maybe some Porto? He heads down the gangplank. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a vendor, Dina. It's like drinking with the help. DINA (DISARMING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you pick the wine, sweetie? It's lovely. Frank grins, pleased. His hand curves around her shoulder. He has forgotten about the other vendor present, the agent. AGENT (AWKWARDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'll messenger over the rider for your signature -- Frank laughs out loud, in a better mood: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You still here? Dina laughs, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella settles the baby on his side, the only Reese sh likes. She starts to close the shutters. Lullaby MUSIC is playing on the baby's TAPE DECK.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: She closes the nursery door as softly as possible. A man's hands go around her throat. Her gasp dies stillborn. It's Alex, kissing her.ear, holding Dina's diamond necklace to her neck. ALEX (MURMURING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he ever come on to you? GABRIELLA (ANGRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sneak up on me that way! ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look how beautiful you are. He's an idiot if he didn't. Now she sees the necklace. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? She snatches the necklace away from him and fairly runs down the hall to Frank's study.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STUDY
dialogues.text: She tries td stuff it in the pouch. Alex is right behind her. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to get me fired and deported. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just put it on for a minute. Look at yourself. She slaps at his hands half-heartedly, but it's so tempting. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what you deserve. GABRIELLA (SUCCUMBING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're both crazy. (CONTINUED)
32 32 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex moves her hair away. She lets him hook the necklace around her neck. He reaches over to open the closet door, fitted out now as a file cabinet, but with the original closet mirror still in place. The safe is visible. Gabriella stares at her reflection, Alex behind her, watching her. The necklace changes her posture. She angles her chin slightly, twists back her hair. Diamonds suit her. GABRIELLA (TITILLATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's vulgar. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: into her ear) Not against your skin. He starts to pleat her T-shirt loose from her jeans. She doesn't resist. They watch each other in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: -- Alex? They're waiting for you! Alex blows out a frustrated breath. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... shit... He hurriedly unhooks the necklace and puts it back in the pouch, gathers up the insurance papers and Polaroids that had spilled and slides them back in the envelope with the pouch.' Gabriella is tucking in her T-shirt. She closes the closet door. Jason's VOICE is closer, more impatient, at the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Alex!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex appears at the top of the stairs, surprising Jason. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the bathroom. He walks down the stairs. A wooden case of liquor is by the terrace doors, where he left it. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a hand, will you? I'm not as young as you are. (CONTINUED)
33 33 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes out the door ahead of Jason, leaving him to carry the case. Jason hears a DOOR CLOSE upstairs as he lifts the case. He looks up. HIS POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reflected in the tall entry mirror, Gabriella's back as she walks away down the hall. RESUME SCENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face tightens. He follows Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A poker game is breaking up. Five players, Alex among them. He's done all right. DAVE -- an older man -- has lost. He tosses down his cards. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out, I'm home. ALEX (SYMPATHETICALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You play for the possibilities, Dave. So do I. Or else why get up in the morning. VICTOR SPANSKY neatly stacks his modest winnings. He's tall, thick-shouldered, 55, with a gray crew-cut, tinted glasses, and a smoker's cough. He does nothing in a hurry. VICTOR (TO DAVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't lose that much. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an optimist in every game. DAVE (PISSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, I don't appreciate -- ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overriding htm, UNRUFFLING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm saying... the guy who sits down at the table with a loser's attitude... loses even if he wins -- which he won't. He's got no juice flowin'. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
34 CONTINUED: ALEX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got peepee in his veins! Life for that guy's a habit and stained pants. You know what I mean? Dave laughs, feeling better. DAVE NOT ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. They all AD-LIB "Good night," "See you next week," etc., as they file out. Alex and Victor are the last in the room. Alex puts on his jacket. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paltry pickings tonight. Alex looks at the small amount of cash on the table. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to cut for what's here. Victor chuckles.. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Why not. He pushes his cash forward into a pot with Alex's. Alex fans the deck across the table. ALEX (CONVERSATIONALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What-are you doing with your life, Victor?. Victor makes a small gesture, indicating the cards. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This, more or less. He pulls a card -- he has good hands -- and turns it up. A king of spades. A smile tugs at his mouth. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat that. Alex produces the Polaroid of Dina's necklace from his inside jacket pocket. (CONTINUED)
34 34 CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flicks it on the table next to Victor's king. Victor's gaze clicks from the photo to Alex, back to the photo. He slowly reaches out and picks it up. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very pretty. I remember when it was the cover of the auction catalogue. The Duchess of Windsor's baubles. Bought for a young wife, I remember. Who I'm sure worked just as hard as the Duchess. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it's appraised at a million three hundred thousand dollars. a laugh. Victor tosses the photo back on the table with VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they say there's no inflation. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have access. Victor shakes his head no. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm retired. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And broke. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need that much. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You need as much as I do. Victor's eyes blink behind his glasses. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of access? For curiosity's sake. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a friend in the house. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girlfriend. How sweet. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IГЇВїВЅcan distract her. (CONTINUED)
34 34 CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR .
dialogues.text: I don't trust women, as a svecies. I'd;have a spotless record if it weren't for a woman. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd never know, I don't want her to know... I like her too much. VICTOR -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust amateurs, either.. He gets up and walks to the door. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take it personally,. Alex. I don't trust the phone company,, the jury system, or the Israeli government. So why should I trust you. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I know a good thing when I see it. Alex flips over a card. It's the king of clubs. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor... Victor has been distracted by Alex's proposition. Now he comes back to scoop up his money. Alex sweeps the cards back into a stack, leaving only the photo on the table. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But this is fifty-fifty.. 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mid-masturbation, Jason is distracted by the BEEPING of the entry ALARM. He glances at the bedside clock that reads 12:30. His excitement subsides,. he rolls onto his stomach. 36

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex detours toward the dark kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne is reading in bed. The door opens slightly. She looks over, her mouth draws in. A bottle of champagne wags around the door, followed by Alex and a pair of champagne flutes. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the light still on. I'm glad you're up. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing the champagne) What'd you do this time? He's too pumped to take offense. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, c'mon, be nice. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever you open champagne -- it's such a giveaway. He pours her a glass. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I was playing poker tonight. He hands her the glass. She takes a sip. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've-never actually seen you play poker -- maybe poker doesn't even exist. Maybe it's just a cover story men use. He laughs. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey; lightning strikes. He fills his glass. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not get into this, honey. Her voice is tired. (CONTINUED)
37 37 CONTINUED: SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was charging the groceries today, and they kept the card. We'd been cancelled. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know -- He reaches for his wallet. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt about as big as an ant. Alex takes out a credit card. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you a new one. FROM HIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out the card, which she slowly takes fingers. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the third time this year. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's about to change. Suzanne has heard that too often from him. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, what are we doing together? We don't talk -- ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: all the time! SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we don't fuck -- we don't even eat dinner together anymoret ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am making an effort heret 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason throws himself out of bed and turns on his STEREO, cranks the volume. He doesn't want to hear their VOICES. 39

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Suzanne hear the MUSIC. He rubs his hand through his hair. (CONTINUED)
39 39 CONTINUED: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you never have a fight with his father? SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard, flat) No. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A saint. I should've guessed. Must be at the right amid of God this very minute. Suzanne doesn't bother replying. She turns off the light, pulls the sheet to her shoulders. Alex sits down on the window seat to enjoy the champagne in the dark. 40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is on the phone. ALEX "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the humidifier wasn't holding a steady percentage, there may be a problem with the regulator -- so I'd better check it right away. (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sure, this afternoon's fine. Hanging up, he rocks back in his chair and squeezes his eyes shut. Then he rests his forehead against the heels of his hands for a moment, considering what he's considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex walks through. Jason's on a ladder stocking the shelves. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to hand me down a good cognac? I'm going out to the Reeses. (REJECTING JASON'S CHOICE)'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, gimme the Pierre Ferrand. Jason starts down the ladder. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll deliver it for you. (CONTINUED)
41 41 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is surprised and pleased by Jason's sudden helpfulness. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to talk. He dusts off the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex follows Dina down a narrow service hall to the wine room. She talks without looking back at him. DINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- enough of an investment in there -- ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- not to want to take a chance, with a month away. That's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE WINE ROOM
dialogues.text: DINA (NEUTRALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A month alone with Frank. Alex chuckles as he starts to inspect the humidifier. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second honeymoon. DINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first one was bad enough. She's standing too close to him, but he has no room to maneuver away. He fiddles with the box. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It may need a part replaced. DINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice suit. You always dress well, Alex. She brushes the lint off his jacket and leaves her hand there. ALEX (GENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --,Dina... this is not a great idea. Used to getting her way, she's not easily dissuaded. (CONTINUED)
42 42 CONTINUED: DINA (SEDUCTIVELY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you tell? She moves up against him. Alex can't will himself to resist. His knee automatically separates her legs. He reaches out to close the door. 43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella is-returning from the laundry room with an arm load of clean crib sheets. Knowing Alex and Dina are inside the wine room, she stops and knocks on the door. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Reese? The baby's ready for YOU-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long moment later, the door opens. Dina and Alex are reassembled, but there's a tension and a breathlessness about them Gabriella recognizes. DINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Thank you, Gabriella. Dina spies some interaction between Gabriella and Alex, and her pretty face hardens. DINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you leave him by himself? GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to get his sheets. DINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the maid's job. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in his playpen. Dina sweeps out. DINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby jail. She looks over her shoulder to make sure Gabriella is behind her. DINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming? (TO ALEX)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Alex. You'll walk yourself out? (CONTINUED)
43 43 CONTINUED: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good cruise. I'll take care of this. DINA (BRIGHTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you in a month. Alex watches the two women move down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIELLA AND DINA
dialogues.text: turn the corner. DINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not very happy here, are you.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ALEX
dialogues.text: as he yanks a wire loose from the humidifier. 44

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex climbs the open stairs, heads down the cantilevered walkway, knocks at Victor's door. For an instant Alex doesn't recognize the uniformed repairman who opens it: Victor, disguised. VICTOR (TICKLED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it? 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By daylight the apartment looks shabby. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I look younger, don't you? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look ridiculous. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I don't have an ego. (zipping up his UNIFORM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- As long as I don't match my mug shots. A shadow of anxiety passes over Alex's face. (CONTINUED)
45 45 CONTINUED: VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to change your mind? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Victor opens the front door.- VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you. As Alex walks toward the door, he catches sight of a free standing hospital respirator in the bedroom. He looks at Victor, who waits for him with an unchanging smile. They go out together. 46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac pulls up, Alex driving, Victor beside him. Mike is not in the guard booth, the gate is closed. 47

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wait in the heat. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Is your makeup melting? Offended, Victor reaches over to honk the horn. Alex stops him, opens the driver's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex goes into the booth, finds the appointment board, checks off "Gates Wine -- Repair," and presses a button that opens the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex slides back behind the wheel. Victor is resting his head on the back of the seat. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brilliant, Alex. We've violated the law before we even get started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the side of the house, the dock. can be seen, empty. Alex rings the front bell. victor is carrying a tool kit. There's no answer. Alex rings it again. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me we're at the wrong house. Alex raises a hand to wave, Victor turns. THEIR POV GOLF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, the guard, is rolling toward them on a security cart. He pulls over. RESUME SCENE ALEX (ALL CHARM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are, Mike. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't flip the gate like that. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was helping you out. I checked off the appointment, didn't you see it? He rings the doorbell again. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sailed out this morning. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know., but the nanny's supposed to be here -- Victor rolls his eyes, unseen. The nanny. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The Venezuelan? They fired her. (with a snigger) Don't pay to be too good-looking in these jobs. Victor interrupts the gossip. He -sounds exactly like a repairman. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a schedule to keep, Mr_ Gates. Is this gonna be another day? (CONTINUED)
50 50 CONTINUED: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't wait. (TO MIKE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll lose his entire wine collection if the humidifier isn't fixed. MIKE (TO VICTOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold Freeman. Mike notes the name "Harold" stitched onto his coveralls. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Stay here. I'll get the keys. He rides away on his cart. Victor sits down in the shade to wait. He stifles a cough. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear God. A cop on the job. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right? VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little too sharply) Why wouldn't I be? 51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is filling a wine order when he hears a woman's VOICE murmuring upstairs, and recognizes Gabriella's. 52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason comes up out of the cellar. Gabriella is passing a note to Robert. GABRIELLA (MID-SENTENCE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where he can reach me. JASON HI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns her head, and he sees that she has been crying. His smile goes. (CONTINUED)
52 52 CONTINUED: GABRIELLA (EMBARRASSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Jason. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looking for Alex? You missed him. ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her. The PHONE RINGS. Robert answers it; wine business. He's out of the conversation. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was supposed to let him into the Reeses'. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now you're in trouble. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. She's walking toward the door. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why've you-been crying? GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got fired, all right? She goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason follows her toward her car parked down the street. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know anything! JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hated it there! GABRIELLA (INFURIATED NOW)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked.the money! I liked having a.roof! (MORE) (CONTINUED)
53 53 CONTINUED :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GABRIELLA (Copt' d ) Now I have to go stay at my cousin's place -- my cousin, her husband, their four kids, and two cats. I hate cats. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with cats? GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shed on the couch I'll have to sleep on. You know how long it took me to find that job? Everybody thinks they're running for office. You don't have papers, they don't even want to meet you. And the only real way to get legal is to get married. Do you understand? He opens her car door for her. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's go get married. Gabriella looks at him. They connect.again; it scares her. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Are you old enough to vote? She slides behind the wheel. JASON (TARTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not too much older. Are you going past the wharf? You can gimme a ride. He's already walking around the car to get in the other side. Gabriella smiles in spite of herself and reaches over to unlock the door for him. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he climbs in) Aren't you working? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my lunch break.. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's not tell the boss I stole you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella drives fast and well. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you do something? Or was it just... GABRIELLA (NODDING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just. They said they.were -- downsizing. Jason laughs. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like they're a factory? GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The size of their staff? It is. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang a left. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for the wharf. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Just turn! She whips the car through the turn, narrowly missing another car. GABRIELLA (SHOUTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idiot! JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Cool. She laughs; she's starting to relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Mike watch victor checking out the humidifier, making a meal of the diagnosis. He notices the wire Alex sabotaged but doesn't remark on it. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you fix the thing, Harold? Or does it have to be replaced? (CONTINUED)
55 55 CONTINUED: VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you after I see the condition of the pipes. Coolant might be leaking. Where's the attic access? 56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor's legs disappear up into the attic as he hauls himself off a step stool and up through the hatch in the ceiling. Mike and Alex watch him go. victor is heard COUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (DISTANTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn fiberglass -- His head drops through the hatch. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Either of, you know how to kill the water to the house? MIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, yeah, sure. Mike starts down the stairs. Alex signals to Victor that he's going with him and follows Mike away. Victor waits until he hears the DOOR CLOSE before dropping down throug the hatch and heading for Frank's office. 57

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella watches Jason walk with a long stride toward Henry's boat. She likes the way he moves. Henry is nearby drinking beer with some Haitians. Jason talks to him for a moment. Henry glances down the walkway to Gabriella, then hands Jason his. keys. Jason gestures to Gabriella to come down. 58

dialogues.speaker: ' EXT. VILLA
dialogues.text: Mike is shutting off the water while Alex watches when another GUARD, mid-30's, turns the corner. GUARD (TO MIKE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Mike looks up, wet and muddy. (CONTINUED)
58 58 CONTINUED: GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been waiting for you. My shift. His uniform is crisp, and his nature is alert and suspicious. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The valve's stuck. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the sprinkler valve. Mike climbs out of the bushes with injured dignity. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you do it. GUARD (QUIETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he the homeowner? ALEX (CHEERFULLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. 59

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor, wearing surgical gloves, is in the file closet cracking the safe. He has re-wired the alarm wire with electrical clips to avoid breaking the circuit. He smears the sweat off his forehead and leans back in close to the dial, rotating it carefully back and forth until the tumblers fall. It opens. victor sifts through papers, foreign currency.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold? Victor hears the FOOTSTEPS coming up the stairs. He keeps searching, but the pressure tells, and his breathing becomes a wheeze. 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new guard follows Alex onto the landing. They hear a DOOR SHUT. The guard instinctively touches his gun. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down there, wasn't it? The guard doesn't let him change direction. (CONTINUED)
60 60 CONTINUED: GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going. 61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: victor drops down onto the stepstool in front of them as they round the corner. VICTOR (BREEZILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can turn the water back on. It's not the pipes. Wearing work gloves, he repositions the hatch cover. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's supposed to be in the house unaccompanied. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that our fault? GUARD (GRUDGINGLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then. The guard glances up at the hatch. In that moment victor winks at Alex; he scored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason drops anchor in turquoise waters off a sand bar, no other boats around. Gabriella takes in the idyllic surroundings. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can learn on the fish around here, but you can't eat 'em. They're junk fish. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you teach me? He laughs. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you think you're ready for that kind of commitment? (CONTINUED)
62 CONTINUED: 62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grins and shrugs. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only investing an afternoon. She takes in the landscape, breathing in the lovely isolation. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father used to bring me here. She hears something in his tone. GABRIELLA (GENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more? Jason concentrates on securing the boat. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. He drowned in a storm. She shivers involuntarily. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a fisherman. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I would like boats after that. He smiles. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel close to him when I'm on the water. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old were you? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Eight. I'd just turned eight. She takes his hand. He tightens his fingers through hers and looks out at the horizon, trying to control the emotions her sympathy has roiled. Gabriella senses this. She puts her arms around him, kisses him on the cheek. They stand, holding each other. Then Jason, on impulse, kisses her on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KEY is heard in the LOCK, the door opens, Victor and Alex come in, giddy with success. Reverentially, Victor unpacks-the necklace and holds it up for them both to admire; the object of desire. VICTOR (BREATHING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Beautiful. Unusual cut. Look at the fire. Hold it up to the light. He hands the necklace to Alex, who lifts it up to look at it. Victor reaches into a drawer. In itHttheeree'ss a gun and a camera. He takes out the camera. necklace. The flash jerks Alex's picture of Alex with gaze from the ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?? VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always take a photograph of the goods. To avoid any disagreement in the sale. The insurance photo is hopeless. You ask yourself how do they stay in business. Alex advances on him. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put me in the shot. VICTOR (MODESTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of insurance. Alex is closing on him. His voice is low and menacing. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the film, Victor._ victor's hand glides into the drawer. Alex sensibly stops short. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ,(pleasantly) We'll tear it up together whet. we have the money. Honor among thieves is a myth, you know. victor's hand reappears, holding not a gun but an airline ticket, which he gives to Alex. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this supposed to be? (CONTINUED)     47 63 63 CONTINUED: VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it over. I can't move it. I'm on parole. I'm known. You're not. So you'll fly to Newark, take a shuttle into the city, catch a cab, take a walk, find an address, I'll give you the name -- pas.de probleme, as they say in Bordeaux. He's being condescending.' ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning you're too chickenshit to do it yourself. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I am. All right, I am. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck... He looks at the ticket. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fly economy. 64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is standing behind Gabriella, helping her cast. His arm grazes her breast. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do anything you want out here -- you can swim nude, you can Her laugh cuts him off. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not taking my clothes off. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered, irritated) That's not what I meant. ONTO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reels the line out of the water. Gabriella climbs the rail. She's barefoot. The breeze blows her thin dress against her legs. JASON HEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dives into the water. He kicks off his shoes, dives in after her. (CONTINUED)
64 64 CONTINUED: HAS HIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they are together, they thetboatГЇВїВЅ,ela ughing i ng her nkl t arm under her breasts, pull i o together. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, quit laughin'. I'm saving your life here. 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The store is closed. Robert has gone home. Alex opens the cash drawer and takes out all the money, fattens his wallet. He spies the message from Gabriella. He reads it, picks up the phone, punches in the number she wrote. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... May I speak with Gabriella? Puedo hablar con Gabriella? (making a face) No, yo no quiero dejar un mesajo, gracias. Voy a llamarla mas tarde. ...Si. Buenas tardes. He hangs up and speed-dials a number from the typed list on the wall. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hey, Ted -- it's Alex Gates. I need a couple of tickets to New York for tonight, first class. (his jaw tightens) Don't sweat the account, I'll pay CASH -- 66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is sprawled half across Gabriella on the deck of th boat, a seat cushion under her head. He has his hand in her panties. She clutches his wrist and pulls his hand back into sight. He lifts his head to look at her. GABRIELLA (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. He sits up, offended. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You waited long enough to tell me. Gabriella arranges her clothes. (CONTINUED)
66 66 CONTINUED: GABRIELLA (FLARING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it felt good, and I'm an idiot! He fondly touches her face with the back of his hand. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not. She scrambles to her feet. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go back now. Can we go back, please? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sure. He stands up and moves to the helm, his legs stiff with injured dignity. Gabriella sits down on the bench, the cushion clutched in front of her. Jason sneaks a look back at her. With her hair wet and her makeup washed away, she looks younger than he does. She's resting her chin on the edge of the cushion. He switches on the engine and eases the boat forward over the anchor, engages the power winch. The CHAIN starts to CLANK. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. She turns her head toward him. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? JASON (LOUDER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. 67

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bridge has parted. Underneath, the boat makes its way on the opalescent water. (CONTINUED)
67 67 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skyscrapers swagger down either side of the river, their windows bright squares against the darkening sky. The signal BELL SOUNDS. 68

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dinner hour. The table in the mean little house is too crowded and too noisy; the television on the buffet can hardly be heard. Gabriella's Cousin and her Husband are arguing in Spanish, in a good-natured marital way, th Kids too busy teasing each other to notice. One Kid gets up to raise the volume on the TV set even louder. Gabriella carries her plate into the kitchen to escape th noise. The Husband makes a gesture to his Wife that says Gabriella's snooty. 69

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella stands at the counter, listlessly finishing her dinner. The PHONE RINGS. She answers it. GABRIETMA HELLO -- 70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex talks into the visor speaker- ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your note. Fuck the Reeses. We're taking a trip, honey. Pack a bag. I'll pick you up in an hour. 71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tension drains from her face; rescued. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Does it matter? GABRIETГўВЂВўT.A (LAUGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Anywhere you are, I want to be there. (CONTINUED)
71 CONTINUED: 71

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ohio. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it's not Ohio. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne turns onto their street, pulls into the garage. She sees Alex's Cadillac already parked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She locks her car and walks toward the elevator, carrying a department store shopping bag. The garage is darker than she likes. Her HEELS ECHO against the cement walls. She walks a little faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne lets herself in. Alex didn't set the alarm. She sets the bag on the couch, next to his jacket. She's been a wife too long not to tidy up after him. She picks up the jacket to brush it and hang it correctly, and glimpse the airline tickets tucked in the inside pocket. Suzanne smiles, moved. The tickets to Rio. She takes a peek to see the dates. Her face changes. She drops the jacket in a heap on the floor. She hears ALEX MOVING around in the bedroom above and starts up the stairs, her rage climbing with every riser. She can hear him HUMMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex zips his passport into an outside compartment where he can reach it. He has almost finished packing. As he reaches for his underwear, he startles. Suzanne is leaning against the door frame. SUZANNE (CONTROLLED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? Alex recovers quickly. (CONTINUED)
75 CONTINUED: 75 ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Napa. I got a problem with a supplier. Boutique wineries -- they're all owned by ex-lawyers. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Via New York? She holds up the tickets. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see the wholesaler. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're amazing, you really are. Now how are you going to explain 'Miss Vasquez?' ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I don't have to. I will, out of courtesy. It's Mrs., and she's fifty years old, Suzanne. She's the agent. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I could even believe you, if I wanted to. ALEX (HARDER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to fight with you on my way out the door. I don't have time for this. Yanking the tickets out of her hand before she can react, he pushes past her with his bag. She follows him down the stairs. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put Terry's life insurance money into that store -- and you spend it on your goddamn girlfriends while my checks bounce. Alex whirls around at the bottom of the stairs. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked my ass off for you with that store. Eight years of twelve- hour days and one-day weekends! So don't tell me I haven't treated you well. (CONTINUED)
75 CONTINUED: (2) 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks his jacket up off the floor and shrugs it on. Suzanne snatches his car keys off the coffee table. Infuriated, he grabs for his keys, but she holds them awa behind her back. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You're going to talk to me! ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I get back. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With more of your fucking lies! I hate you! Wasting my (slapping at his arm with her free hand) -- life! ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sssh, calm down -- She tries to slap him again, but he gets hold of her hand ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Give me my keys, I need my keys. I don't want to hurt you. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you ever do! He twists her hand up behind her back, forcing her onto the sofa. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell! He smothers her into the cushion and twists her hand up and up. She grips his keys tighter. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless from the STRUGGLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open your hand, Suzanne. Pinning her down, he painfully pries open her fingers. She drives her elbow into his face. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sonofabitch! He hits her back, her nose starts to gush, the keys drop to the-floor. He bends to pick them up. Suzanne seizes a standing metal ashtray and savagely swipes him across the temple. (CONTINUED)
75 75 CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blow sends him sprawling to the floor; he doesn't move. She is stunned by what she has done. In a panic she races up the stairs, the heel of her hand to her nose to staunch the bleeding. 76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne spills everything out of Alex's suitcase and starts throwing in her own clothes, blood-spotting them i her haste. 77

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne jerks out his drawers so fast that she dumps them on the floor. She pulls his suit out of the closet along with an armful of other clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne drags two suitcases clattering down the stairs. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hasn't moved. Suzanne drops to her knees beside him and squeamishly lifts his wallet out of his pocket, snatches the cash, lets the wallet fall back beside him. Her breathing is so rapid and shallow it sounds like whimpers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne backs out the door pulling the suitcases, right into Jason. She cries out in fright. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Hey, hey. SUZANNE (FRANTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Don't go in therel We're LEAVINGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the blood smeared all over her face, her clothe:, and charges past her. SUZANNE - JA-SONII

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to kill, Jason is shocked to see the job apparently already done for him. He bends over Alex to see if he's dead, and is equally sorry and relieved to find out he isn't.

dialogues.speaker: SUZANNE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I won't wait for you! Jason takes the stairs two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He yanks his map of the Gulf off the wall and grabs his fishing gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex's unconscious body blocks the closet. door. Jason tries to open it anyway, but Alex is 'too heavy. Seizing hold of him, Jason drags him away from the door. The jewelry pouch spills out of Alex's pocket. Jason doesn't see it. The HORN BLARES, outside. Jason pulls his rod out of the closet. As he steps over Alex, he spots the pouch, the drawstring loose enough to let the necklace protrude. The HORN BLASTS again. Jason swoops up the pouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason runs for the car with his gear and climbs in. Suzanne peels away before the door is completely closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Suzanne. She can't look at him. She concentrates on her driving. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened in there? SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough. What'd you hit him with? SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -+ The ashtray. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
84 84 CONTINUED: SUZANNE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a laugh bubbles out of HER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, an ashtray. (LAUGHING HARDER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He-doesn't even smoke! On the verge of hysteria, she's laughing so hard, she can hardly drive. Tears run down her face, muddying the dried blood; she's a holy mess. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over, pull over. He wrenches the wheel and steers the car to the curb. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm driving. 85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
