dialogues.text: He gets out and lopes around the car to the driver's side The car recedes down the highway. 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella is sitting on the front step with her suitcase, waiting. She rubs her legs as though she has been there a long time. The DOGS are BARKING inside. 87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE is RINGING. Alex still hasn't moved. 88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is waiting behind the wheel. Suzanne gets back in the car. She has pulled a cotton sweater over her bloody clothes and washed her face. She's presentable again, and subdued. He starts the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . drives. (CONTINUED)
89 89 CONTINUED: SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you figure out where we're going? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll head for the Gulf, see what we like. He sounds like her contemporary, not her kid. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . I remember your dad saying the sand was as white as the whites of God's eyes, on the Gulf. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still miss him? Slowly she shakes her head no. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see his face anymore. I can't hear his voice. (DREAMILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But when you come home from fishing -- with the sea and the salt and the engine oil? It's like he's walking through the door. I love that smell -- I can still smell him. She watches the highway posts clack past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor is soaking a dishtowel under the faucet. He wrings it out. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mugged-by your wife. How ironic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor comes into the room with the wet towel and throws it at Alex, who is sitting now on the couch. Alex catch:s it, holds it to his bloody head. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll fucking kill her. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do the Reeses come home? (CONTINUED)
91 CONTINUED: 91 ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for a month. Plenty of time. Victor sighs. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long a drive is it? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the Gulf? Three hours. He removes the towel from his head. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to need stitches. Do you have a sewing kit? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stop at my doctor's. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I darned my own socks in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne and Jason cross the parking lot toward the coffee shop, which anchors a suburban surface mall. He notices a jewelry store. They reach the restaurant. He opens the door for Suzanne. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order something for me, okay? I'm stiff, I need to walk around. He's already walking away. Concern and exasperation cancel each other; she goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason approaches the cheerful, elderly JEWELER repairing an earring behind the case. The man puts away his smile. Jason's long hair and leather jacket offend him. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grandmother asked me to bring in a necklace of hers -- Jason takes the velvet pouch out of his pocket, unlaces it, spreads out the necklace on the counter. He leans forward on his elbows while the jeweler examines it with a loupe. When the jeweler looks up, he's angry. (CONTINUED)
93 CONTINUED: 93 JEWELER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your grandmother lets you carry around a million dollars worth of jewelry? Go put it back where you found it. The jeweler pours the necklace back in the pouch, cinches it closed, slaps it on top of the case. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Those aren't real diamonds. JEWELER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your grandmother to bring it in. The jeweler BUZZES the door to release it. Jason grabs the velvet pouch, strides out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITRESS unloads plate after plate on the table where Suzanne is waiting for Jason. WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- pan san, strawberry waffle, eggs over, side of wheat toast, ham steak, hash browns, fruit cup, two O.J.'s,, coffee, milk -- SUZANNE'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Extra syrup? Jason returns. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll starve. The waitress laughs as she strolls away. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry. He's worried about the jeweler. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's pack it up, picnic on the beach someplace. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a grin) What a romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jason and Suzanne reach the car, he sees the jeweler o the sidewalk now, outside the store, gesticulating to a sign painter. JASON MOM --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to tell her he took the necklace. SUZANNE (BREEZILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- No, 1111 drive. The jeweler happens to glance in their direction. Jason ducks into the car, unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Suzanne are sitting on a small, rickety pier, eating from the takeout boxes open on their laps. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I feel... exhilarated. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrenalin does that. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It ain't adrenalin, it's freedom. And she slips her wedding ring off her finger and hurls i overhand as far as she can. It drops into the sea. SUZANNE (EXULTANT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want one goddamn thing of HISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She eats with gusto. Jason is staring at the water. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne is driving now. She glances over at Jason sprawled low in the seat. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're quiet. She doesn't think he's going to answer her. (CONTINUED)     97 97 CONTINUED: JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't even say goodbye. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll work itself out. People manage. We're here. This is what you always wanted. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- How much money do we have? Suzanne doesn't reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the reception window Suzanne is checking in with the MOTEL OWNER, a solidly-built, ruddy woman in her fifties who shouldn't wear sleeveless blouses. Suzanne has her wallet open. Her fingers hesitate at the credit card. OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a cash discount. Ten percent. SUZANNE (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like cash. She starts to count it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ensconced at a table under an umbrella, Jason is writing on a paper towel.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dear Gabriella. I don't know if you'll get this letter. I don't know if I'll send it. All I know is that for some reason I need to write it...

dialogues.speaker: SUZANNE AND THE OWNER
dialogues.text: cross the parking lot. SUZANNE (CALLING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jase! He crumples the paper towel. She holds up the keys for him to see. (CONTINUED)
99 CONTINUED: 99 OWNER (ENVIOUSLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have given you the king- size. Suzanne isn't offended. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my son. The owner gives her a startled glance. OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great! Suzanne laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is sitting on the lawn chair outside the room door, working on his letter again under the yellow bug light. The Coke MACHINE HUMS noisily next to him.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That day on the boat made me realize I understand the sea better than I do the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne stirs awake, disoriented, spooked. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason? She sits up in bed. Jason comes in from outside. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right here. Suzanne shoves her fingers through her damp hair, swallow to clear her voice. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I dreamed I was in jail. You'd come to see me, you were on the other side of the plastic -- like at the bank?. And you were talking, but I couldn't hear you. I put my ear to the holes and I couldn't hear you, but your mouth was moving. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
101 101 CONTINUED: SUZANNE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I realized you couldn't talk anymore. He'd cut your vocal cords, like that dog next door. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What dog? She lies down again. SUZANNE-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were a kid? JASON (GENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm on watch. Don't worry. 102

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The. car speeds north. Alongside, the Gulf shimmers under the mirror of the sky.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- I know what lure to use to catch any fish in the water, but what's the lure for a woman? Truth? Lies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tint combed through her hair, the plastic cap tied in a rakish bow, Suzanne lays out what remains of her cash by denomination. She records the amount in a pocket notebook she's using as a ledger.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: One morning, just as the sky started to lighten --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is fishing.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: -- I caught a fish that had three hooks grown through his lips. Three times he'd gotten away. He kept taking the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is gutting and skinning his catch.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It occurs to me that you're the fisherman, not me. I can feel the tension of the line. I've taken the hook just like he did. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: A MAP OF THE GULF 106
dialogues.text: Coastal towns have been crossed out, one after the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, stitches in his head, pores over the map while Victor talks on the phone. He circles a new town on the Gulf, farther north. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- eight-faceted cut... quite unique... could be the whole piece or individual stones, preference for the whole piece. Will you put out the word?... (LAUGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm consulting for the insurance company, isn't life strange? -- Love and kisses. He hangs up. His cheeriness vanishes. He coughs, more like a gag, and heads for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor spits blood in the sink. Then, after catching his breath, squirts medicine down his throat with his inhaler exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've called the whole network of fences from here to Tampa. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope we'll find her before she sells. (CONTINUED)
109 CONTINUED: 109

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor picks up a chair and smacks it down. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What's wrong? VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a water-view suite in Marbella! Did you notice? There's no fruit and champagne from the management. I don't see Swiss chocolate on the pillows. My masseuse is not at the door. And I am fucking dying, Alex! ALEX (SHOCKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Victor. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't intend to cough to death in a county clinic because you screwed up! ALEX (QUIETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not fair. The plan was for you to move the necklace. I wouldn't have had the goddamn thing. Come on... sit down... try to relax. He reaches for victor's cigarettes and crumples the package in his fist. Victor looks at his ruined smokes. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not good at giving up things. 110 ГўВЂВў INT. DOCKSIDE RESTAURANT - DAY 110 Jason eats a sandwich at a'table, working on his letter.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I want to take you out with me when the wind's blowing whitecaps and the current's running against the wind, just to hear your hair slap against your skin. When will I see you? He glances up. (CONTINUED)
110 110 CONTINUED: SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: her hair a better, brighter color under her chef's hat, i cooking on the grill behind the counter, kidding the customers, enjoying herself. The greasy-aproned OWNER pats her rump as he goes by, not for the first time. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long arms, short dick, they always say. One of the Fishermen guffaws. The owner looks pissed. So does Jason who witnessed it all. OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside; to Suzanne) Can I see you in the office after lunch, please? SUZANNE (NOT INTIMIDATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne luxuriates in a. bubble bath, a glass of wine in her hand, the bottle next to the tub. She's talking to Jason through the closed door. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was not-fired, you jerk. I quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is prying a diamond out of the necklace with his fishing knife.

dialogues.speaker: SUZANNE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (with a laugh) For about a minute it was very satisfying. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concentrating on the WORK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason has put on his suit, changed his looks. He sizes up the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason scans the case as he approaches the JEWELER. JEWELER. Help you? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you buy estate diamonds? JEWELER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Jason takes out a zip-lock bag and lays it on the counter one of the diamonds inside. The jeweler takes it out with respect and holds it under his loupe. If Jason's nervous, it doesn't show. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It belonged to my mother. The jeweler's heard every version. He doesn't care. JEWELER -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Price is the same. I can give you eighty-five hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The classified section already folded and marked beside her, Suzanne has propped herself on her elbows. She's looking out to sea. Talking heads bob like buoys, the waders. She notices, some distance away, a man in a suit walking along the beach. The image amuses her. He's moving in her direction. She finally recognizes Jason and raises her hand. SUZANNE (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sailor... She puts on her hat to cut the glare. From under the brim she admires his approach. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he reaches her) ... Look at you. What's the occasion? Jason squats down beside her and balls up the classifieds JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need another grab-ass job. I been out talking to peoplel (MORE) (CONTINUED)
115 115 CONTINUED: JASON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's charter outfits a coupla towns up the coast. (NAMES OF TOWNS). They need skippers, they need crews. She stands up, brushes off the sand, rolls up her towel. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're packing. They start walking together. From the water a MAN calls out to Suzanne. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I thought you were coming back in. She smiles and waves goodbye. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Too bad. I kinda liked that GUY-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Jason keep walking. He no longer looks like a boy. 116

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is smelling his brandy in a booth. He looks defeated. Victor swings onto a bar stool. He takes out a wallet photo of Suzanne and Jason and passes it across to the BARTENDER. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen them, by any chance? BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you asking? VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife and son. He's been selling fish around these parts. He's totally believable. The bartender feels for his pain and takes another look at the photo, shakes his head no. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a little classier than our usual clientele, y'know? VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you could pass it down anyway. (CONTINUED)
116 116 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender takes the photo. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, man. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: joins Alex in the booth. Victor raises his hand. Alex instinctively pulls his head back. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move. He leans across the table and plucks the last stitch out of Alex's wound. Alex winces. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been irritating me all day. Did I hurt you? Threat implied. Alex stares him down.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, I know this kid -- Alex and victor glance over to the bar and see Henry. He's looking at the photo Victor passed around. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunches a catch like a depth finder. Victor is already out of the booth.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR AND HENRY
dialogues.text: Henry senses money to be made. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His father. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought his father was dead. (shaking his head) Well, you look bad all right, but not dead. VICTOR (DEFENSIVELY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungover, that's all. I'm his stepfather. (CONTINUED)
116 116 CONTINUED: (2) HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a chuckle) Oh, man, now I see why he blew town. victor's insulted enough to lose his patience and his poise. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question before us is where did he go. Henry says nothing. He wants to be paid. Victor whips out a fifty-dollar bill from his top pocket. Henry reaches for it, but victor holds it back, wanting an answer first. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't be on the Gulf. He hated the Gulf. Alex has moved up to the bar to listen behind him, unnoticed. He shakes his head at victor. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's down in the Keys somewhere. Victor puts the fifty back in his own pocket. Henry stands aggressively. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't cool in my book! In a swift, unexpected move, victor jams Henry back down on his bar stool. The bartender starts toward them. Alex slips out the door. The stool and Henry are toppling over. Victor catches them both, sets Henry upright. VICTOR (EVENLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now sit there,. and calm down. Victor is ill, but not weak. Henry looks away, the classic signal of submission. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. 117

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is waiting for victor outside. (CONTINUED)
117 117 CONTINUED: ALEX (PLEASED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't be too far. Victor stares at him. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never understand your optimism. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or he wouldn't have lied.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, mister! ALEX (TO VICTOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you made a friend. Victor turns around, Alex keeps walking. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is in the doorway to the bar. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to you if I see the kid? Victor smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 118
dialogues.text: From a distance we see Jason follow a beefy, jeans-wearin salesman into the building.

dialogues.speaker: ' INT. DRYDOCK
dialogues.text: The Salesman walks Jason past the vertical rows of boats, stacked from ceiling to floor, extolling the virtues of his stock. Jason inspects a modest boat, takes out cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is helming a classic wooden fishing boat, THE HERCULES II, old and not too big, but with good lines. He's purely happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason steers toward the beach and drops anchor. There's a cabin among the palmettos. No car. 122

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason comes into the cabin. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just to be sure) Mom? The cabin is silent. He uses his fishing knife to pop loose a section of the cheap wall paneling. Behind it, a square of sheet rock has been sliced away between the studs to accommodate the pouch. He drops the pouch in his tackle box. A CAR is heard pulling up. Jason frantically starts to jam the paneling back in place. It won't hold. 123

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne takes a flat of geraniums out of the trunk and sets them on the porch. She opens the door. 124

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Suzanne steps through the screen door, Jason sees that his tackle box is open, the velvet pouch in plain sight. He kicks the top closed, bends to lock it. SUZANNE (CASUALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll think you stole it. He looks up at her, caught. She's walking toward the kitchen sink to wash the nursery dirt off her hands. She looks out the window at the boat again. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice boat. (over her shoulder) Are you allowed just to run around with it? 'His tension ebbs. He picks up his tackle box. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot my tackle box. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Don't take advantage, Jason. They trusted you with the job. (CONTINUED)
124 124 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her quickly. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a problem. He escapes out the door. 125

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is sitting on the bed, dialing a number. He can see Victor shirtless in the bathroom. (His scars surprise us). Victor is trying with effort to suppress a cough. 126

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella is cooking herself dinner. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? She's greedily grateful to hear Alex's voice. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Hi! I saw on the news there's rain in San Francisco. Are you wet and miserable? 127

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted, Alex stretches out on the bed to talk to her. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Napa's farther north. Victor comes out of the bathroom. He's waiting for news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans on the counter, flirting with his voice. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you love me.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I love you. Her smile vanishes. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who just laughed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex holds the phone out to Victor. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to talk to you. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please. Why? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fucking say hello, okay? Victor takes the phone. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, dear. Alex snatches the phone back from him. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy? Satisfied? I'm working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His harsh tone unsettles her. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are there any messages? She carries the phone to the counter where she keeps mail and any messages and starts to leaf through the stack. Her eye falls on a crumpled light blue envelope; she move it out from the pile. It has been forwarded several times. And it's addressed to her. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lonely here. There's no return address. She slits it open with her thumbnail. A trickle of sand falls out.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What about the messages? GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking! Instead, she opens the letter. (CONTINUED)
130 130 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (V..O.-)
dialogues.text: Dear Gabriella. I've started this letter a dozen times --

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (V..0.)
dialogues.text: Gabby? She puts down the letter and quickly- finds the message memo. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is. Mr. Raines called from (NAME OF TOWN). He said you-Id know what it was about. Do you,- need the number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting up, Alex signals success to Victor and writes dow the number. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, honey. I'll call-you tomorrow. G'd'night . He hangs up, excited. Victor has already started to pack. ALEX (TO VICTOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you had no faith.. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll save the party hats until it's in our hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella is reading the second page of Jason's letter.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I look out at the flat blue sea, and the darker bl ue where the Gulf deepens and I want you next to me. ГўВЂВўI want to walk across the. sugar sand and wade into the water with you until the current lifts us and floats us, nothing weighting us down -- as'light and thoughtless as fish. Will I ever see you?... Love,: Jason. (CONTINUED)
132 132 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's deeply moved. And it occurs to her that she has picked the wrong man. 133

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEAR THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Modest, nondescript. Victor parallel parks jewelry store with his usual careful manner. 134

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor and Alex kid each other without rancor for the moment. ALEX -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss the Cadillac. Top down. Air on. VICTOR (LAUGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have pimp's tastes, Alex. At least my car's inconspicuous. Alex starts to get out. Victor doesn't. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right? VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of these jewelers might know my face. It's risky. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about for me? Victor takes out the photo of Alex with the necklace and holds it up for him. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's seen this yet. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sick. I'll do it. Alex throws open the door and barrels out of the car. Г‚ВЂВў 135

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeweler who bought the diamond from Jason lays it on a velvet pad for Alex, who's posing as the insurance investigator. (CONTINUED)
135 135 CONTINUED: JEWELER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a shrug) Said it was his mother's. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seventeen-year-old kid waltzes in with a diamond as big as your toenail, and you don't wonder?? You shouldn't have touched iti You know that! All right, okay. When we recover the rest of the necklace, I'll be back. Do not, do not sell it. I'll see what I can do for you, Raines. JEWELER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i appreciate that. 136

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor and Alex are having a beer near the wide-screen TV A game is on. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart lady. She lets Jason make the sale. They get caught, he's underage, and she don't know a thing. I gotta give her credit. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have interesting taste in women. Alex's gaze wanders to the game, but he can't get interested. 137

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It barrels up the highway, passing the same landmarks Suzanne and Jason did. 138

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor is driving, Alex reading the map. He circles a town name. Victor cranes to see it. 139

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A storm is blowing in, and Jason walks quickly along the docks to his boat and swings aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waves have already started to slap against the sides of the boat. Jason tosses over his fenders and secures them to protect the boat from the pilings. He starts toward the cabin. The lock has been popped. The door is slightly ajar. He hears a NOISE inside. He draws his knife. 141

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason throws open the door. A figure is bent over in the galley. It turns, and by the light of the refrigerator Jason recognizes Henry. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Henry... What the hell you doing?... How'd you know this was my boat?? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you cast off. Good little sport boat you got, too. Oh, whoa -- hear that? JASON (PARANOID)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where -- what?? Henry rubs his stomach. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here, man. I ain't been eating my share since my fishing partner ran off. Without so much as goodbye/good luck. Jason blows out a breath. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's complicated. HENRY (NODDING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always is. The boat is rockirg now. The WIND has picked up. They hear the CLANKING and RUBBING of the other boats. Jason starts checking all the hasps and latches while Henry eat the sandwich he made. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are you on the Gulf? (CONTINUED)
141 141 CONTINUED: HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My baby finally sank on me. Right at the dock. I thought I'd work charter for awhile. (moving to help Jason with the latches) -- Need a crew? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not why I came looking for you. Jason is checking the engine. Out of Henry's sight, he surreptitiously reaches inside a hidden compartment. HIS HAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wraps around the concealed pouch and withdraws, reassured JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: secures the engine hatch. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy offered me fifty bucks to tell him where you were. Sick old motherfucker. Big as God. Tried to say he was your stepfather. JASON (CAREFULLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no -- this guy was not any kind of family man, if you know what I mean. So you're in some deep shit, because he wasn't a cop neither. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What'd you tell him? Henry chuckles. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of ways to make fifty bucks. Misunderstanding, Jason shoves him up against the counter (CONTINUED)
141 141 CONTINUED: (2) JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna lean on me, Henry?? Is that the plan? Henry is hurt and offended. HENRY (WITH DIGNITY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man, I wouldn't stoop that low. And if I'd taken the fifty, I wouldn't have to be eating your shitbag sandwich neither. Jason steps back, ashamed of himself. He sits down to recover. Henry looks at him with a friend's concern. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You -- um -- you moving contraband, Jason? Jason shakes his head no. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy struck me as a serious problem. A few raindrops spatter the windows. Jason makes for the cabin door. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of the boat? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a grateful smile) Not likely to sink two of 'em. 142

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason lopes along the quay, toward the businesses at the far end. The sky is about to open. 143

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working behind the counter, Suzanne leans on her elbows, chatting up a customer. Jason comes through the back door. She turns. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Mom, come on. He catches her hand and tows her toward the back door. (CONTINUED)
143 143 CONTINUED: SUZANNE (ALARMED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, what's happened? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We"gotta go... She anxiously follows him out the door. THE CUSTOMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leans back to see around the snack rack that blocked our view of him. It's Victor. A paper bag under his arm, he goes out the front door. 144

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain is sheeting down. Cars fishtail slightly on the grease not yet washed from the streets. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reaches his car with a long stride; he can't run. 145

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne is driving. 'Jason has told her. He glances at her sideways. She takes a long breath. The rain speeds up. She switches on the wipers. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I should have gone through his pockets myself. It didn't occur to me. I was in such a panic. If I'd found the necklace, Jason? I'd have taken it, too. 146

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops at a light. 147

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor and Alex spot Suzanne's car idling at the intersection. Victor is eating an apple from the bag. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she accelerates, Suzanne reaches over to pat Jason's hand. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm sorry. She glances in the rear view mirror. Headlights. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I'm the one who hit the bastard. HER POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small bridge ahead is almost ready to pivot to let a boat pass. She stamps down on the gas pedal. The car rockets forward. 149

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge gate is lowering. Victor guns the car under the gate and across the pivoting bridge just as the gap opens. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a thrill. THEIR POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason's white face is turned toward them in Suzanne's car ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, easy -- he'll see us. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining too hard. 150

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason looking out the back window sees only the headlight and rain. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still with us. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's just a tourist cruising around with his head up his butt. Neither of them believes that. (CONTINUED)
150 150 CONTINUED: SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How about Mexico? The Sea of Cortez? Your father fished for marlin there. The biggest catch he ever had. sharp left, She sees a side road coming up. She hangs a skidding into the turn, traction holding. 151

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor can't make the turn in time. ALEX TURN1 VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. She's not going anywhere. He brakes and calmly reverses in the rain. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need to talk to her. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time you talked, she almost crushed your skull. (TRAVELING) 152

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne is driving fast. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything? JASON (CHECKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a_car in sight. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? HIS POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headlights turn onto the road. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hears his silence and looks back herself just as he looks forward. (CONTINUED)
152 152 CONTINUED: JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! Face the road! You're drifting! She looks back as now bright headlights light them up. A truck HORN BLASTS. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Shit! She 'spins the wheel to avoid a head-on, but in so doing she clips the curb and loses control. She throws an arm across Jason to protect him. The car rolls onto its top, scraping across the road. 153

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The upside-down car rips through a fence, slides down off the road. The engine dies. The only SOUND is the SPINNING back TIRE and the WINDSHIELD that now caves in. 154

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor swerves to the side of the road. Alex leaps out of the car and runs toward the wreck. Victor follows at a slower pace, opening his umbrella. He's still eating his apple. He sees a neighboring house light come on in response to the crash.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE WRECK
dialogues.text: Alex is trying to open the jammed door when Victor reache him. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have much time. Through the window they can see Suzanne and Jason, both unconscious, limbs entangled, covered in glass. Suzanne is hemorrhaging from a gash in her side. Her leg twitches in spasm. Car headlights pass by on the road. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get some help! VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already on the way, I'm afraid. (CONTINUED)
154 154 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex kicks out what remains of the back side window and slithers into the car. Victor calls in after him. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the trunk, please. He walks toward the back. 155

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the car upside-down, Alex has to reach under the sea to press the trunk release. 156

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is rocked far enough forward on its hood to enabl the trunk to open. The contents cascade onto Victor. He starts his search, the apple gripped between his teeth. 157

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His own breathing noisy and shallow, Alex brushes the glass away from Suzanne's face. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Oh, Christ... He lifts her shirt to see how badly she's cut and presses the heel of his hand against the gash to try to stop the bleeding. Her blood spurts through his fingers. With his other hand he pats down her body. SUZANNE (BARELY CONSCIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jase... Alex checks Jason for her, searching his limp body at the same time. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's okay, Suzanne. Just' tell me where it is. She can't answer. He opens the glove compartment and feels inside. He goes through her purse. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit! Leaning over the seat, he fumbles with her clothes. He's trying to make her comfortable. (CONTINUED)
157 157 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he reaches down her bra, into her panties, searching Her voice is faint. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't... ALEX (GENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sssh, I have to. Don't be scared. I'm not going to hurt you. 158

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS begin to be heard, closing. Victor bends down next to the car. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, c'mon, get out of there. 159

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex roars at victor. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dying, for chrissake! (TO SUZANNE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear the sirens? Help's coming. Just tell me where it is and let me get out of your lives. She whispers something. He leans in close. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? -- ГўВЂВў She mumbles something indecipherable. He puts his close to her mouth. The SIRENS are bearing down. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (only a breath) ... Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: We're out of time, Ale7. You can stay if you want, but I've left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex's feet pop out through the window. He's trying to shimmy himself backward out of the car, harder than going in, the principle of a lobster trap. (CONTINUED)
160 160 CONTINUED: ALEX HELP MET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor grabs his ankles and pulls. Alex starts to reemerge. 161

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked down the road in a row of onlookers, Alex and Victor watch the fire department, working under portable lights, pry.Jason and Suzanne out of the car. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I didn't mean for this to happen. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as they see her license they'll call you in Miami. Alex nods. He can't look away from the scene. FADE TO BLACK. 162

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is semi-conscious. His eyes flutter open for a second in the dark, then he sinks again. 163

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason resurfaces. Alex is half-asleep in the chair, his bloody clothes changed. The newspaper droops from his fingers. Jason's voice cracks from disuse. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: what are you... He swallows painfully. Alex smiles and gets up from the chair. He dreads what he has to tell him. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there... how do you feel? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my mother? (CONTINUED)
163 163 CONTINUED: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dodging the question) I flew straight back from Napa when I heard. You hit your head pretty hard. Jason struggles to sit up, his equilibrium not fully restored. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mom? -- How's Mom? Alex sits down on the bed with him to break the news. ALEX (QUIETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jason... I'm so sorry. Jason stares at him. He hasn't absorbed the fact. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't make it as far as the hospital. Horror and rage flood Jason's face. JASON

dialogues.speaker: N000
dialogues.text: He seizes the empty I.V. stand and hurls it at Alex, who throws up his arm protectively. Jason tackles Alex under his guard, smashing him into the metal dresser. Alex's head snaps backward, cracking the mirror. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You killed her, you fuckl Alex tries to hold him, eventually in a forced bear-hug. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Don't, don't -- (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need someone in here! JASON (WEAKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me! Alex holds him close. He collapses in Alex's arms. An ORDERLY hurries in, followed by a Nurse. ORDERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take care of him. (CONTINUED)
163 163 CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex hesitates, then goes out. 164

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is conferring quietly with a staff member behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor picks the lock. Alex doesn't follow him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor hits every spot where amateurs hide their treasures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A) Victor's hand lifts the tub drain. B) Victor feels the back of a dresser. VICTOR (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be nice to have some help. C) Victor unscrews the trap under the kitchen sink. D) Et cetera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is sitting on the stairs, staring out at the Gulf. He gives no indication of having heard Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor lays his cheek along the living room wall to eyeball it for irregularity. A smile hoists his cheeks. He pops the paneling loose. His smile collapses. The niche carved between the'studs is empty. He rests his head against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex walks down the corridor to Jason's room. He taps on the door. There's no answer. He pushes open the door. The room is empty, the bed stripped. Alex barrels out of the room to confront the tired young DOCTOR he sees walking down the hall. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my son?? DOCTOR (PUZZLED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I released him this morning. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let an underage boy with a head injury walk out of here by himself?? DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was only a concussion. He's fine. He said you were in the lobby. Nothing to be gained, Alex whirls around and strides away 171

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is running down the road, his face contorted. 172

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason keeps running onto the sand. He kicks off his shoes and plunges into the water and swims. Swims until he's exhausted and gasping. He tips his head back in the water and screams his grief to the pitiless sky. 173

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truck pulls over, Jason swings down and waves goodbye. 174

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason appears, walking down the street. He looks into the garage. Seeing Alex's Cadillac, he smiles a tight smile. 175

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason unlocks the door and starts turning of f the alarm before the door is wide enough open to trip the delay. (CONTINUED)
175 175 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are off. He closes the door and starts up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: His hand goes into his pocket as he advances on the maste bedroom. He takes out his knife. 176

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves toward the bed. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, Alex. I want to see your face. The sheets stir. Jason raises his knife to strike. But it isn't Alex in the bed, it's Gabriella. She lets out a strangled scream. He whips the sheet off her with his other hand. She's naked. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason! (her eyes on his knife) -- Don't hurt me. Please. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went to get you! He's not coming back until tomorrow. She timidly pulls the sheet over her body. Jason yanks it off her so hard it flaps loose from the corners. He touches her belly with the length of his knife, the blade ГўВЂВў flat to her skin. She freezes. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His car's here. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been here since he went to Napa. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep hearing about Napa. Did you ever call him there? She shakes her head. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know where he was. (CONTINUED)
176 176 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swallows to clear her voice. Her- eyes haven't left the knife. GABRIELLA. Why would he lie to me? Ever so lightly Jason's fingertips find her skin. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't waste any time,. did you. You moved right in. GABRIELLA. You don't need the knife.. Put. the knife down. She knows men and children well enough to demand, not beg Jason has almost forgotten he still. has the knife agains her. He lifts it and folds it and puts it away. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to wait for him, and. I'm going to kill him. His hand drifts along her body. She doesn't resist. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll lock you up. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Away from the sky and the air and the sea and the current running against the wind?' That was a very beautiful letter. Jason moves onto the bed, on his knees. beside her. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you show it to him? You two have a laugh about it? GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never mentioned itl Jason's hand curves around her throat,. a, caress, a thre JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him how to find: us-? Gabriella knocks his hand away from her throat. (CONTINUED)
176 176 CONTINUED: (2) GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not He wasn't interested, he didn't care. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, he did. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was glad she left. Jason lies down alongside her. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had us followed. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-why? He shrugs; he doesn't trust her. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know? She thinks grief has driven him crazy, and he sees that. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not crazy. Gabriella lays her hand over his on the bed, to comfort him. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm so very sorry about what happened to your mother. His hand skitters away and lights on her ribs. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her loss, your gain. Furious, Gabriella forgets her caution. She slaps him hard enough to throw his head sideways. Jason rolls on top of her and pins her down. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her home, her bed -- her life. He lowers his mouth to Gabriella's neck. His kiss is surprisingly gentle. His knee works her legs apart. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . Don't do this for revenge. (CONTINUED)
176 176 CONTINUED: (3) JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's finish what we started. Slowly, he kisses her. She lets her mouth respond: a sweet kiss, in spite of the circumstances. His fingers scissor her nipple. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't tell me that you love me. He peels off his T-shirt. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a whisper) I love you. He gives her a hard look. She holds his gaze and pushes his jeans down until he finally kicks them off and they'r both naked. They begin to make love. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Jason doesn't understand. She gently pushes him back. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way. She turns on her stomach and guides him back into her. Jason moves now rapidly. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly. Her hand on his ass guides the pace. She hasn't had a young man in a long time. GABRIELLA (IN SPANISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing to me? (IN ENGLISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come, not yet. They move as one, their passion enveloping them. He makes her come first. Then, when her boay flattens, he also comes and he's lying on top of her, his face alongside hers, their breath gentling. Finally, they lie side.by side. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you get me a towel? With warm water. (CONTINUED)
176 176 CONTINUED: (4)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her and gets up. If she didn't love him before, she does now. 177

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While he runs the water to'warm it, he looks at himself naked in the mirror. His face crumples. He no longer knows what he's doing. 178

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings the towel back to Gabriella, who wipes herself. Her mood, too, has sobered. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Are you going to kill me, too? JASON (REPELLED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to. I'll know. I'll be a witness. I'll know you planned it. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Would you do that? GABRIELLA (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like-you too much to let you kill him. Jasonstarts to put on his clothes: GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need him, Jason. JASON (FURIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't -- you don't! GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going back to Caracas! You don't know how we live there. She pulls the pillow in front of her to hide her nakedness. He touches her shoulder; she shrugs him away. (CONTINUED)
178 178 CONTINUED: GABRIELLA (GROWING FRANTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to leave now, Jason. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? This is my home. I'm home. She stares at him. His face is set. She can't persuade him. Jason thinks of his next step, a plan. GABRIELLA (COLDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not your room, though, is it. Jason starts toward the door. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never going to marry him, Gabriella. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch me. He closes the door with a solid CLICK. She starts to cry, and still crying, she pulls the sheets off the bed, she has to change the sheets. 179

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason leans against the wall, his eyes squeezed shut, listening to her CRY. 180

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex carries his suitcase toward the condo. 181

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex puts his key in the lock, opens the door. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he goes in) Gabby? 182

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is too astonished to say a word. Jason and Gabriella are having lunch at the kitchen table. (CONTINUED)
182 182 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex sets down his suitcase. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been looking for you for two days! Jason relishes this. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've called home. Alex advances. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get here? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hitchhiked. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too bright and NERVOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you-hungry? Have you had lunch? Alex doesn't even hear her. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you wait for me? Jason eats without answering. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about all your stuff, and your mother's? Jason swallows, wipes his mouth. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't need it anymore, and I don't want it. Gabriella brings Alex a cup of coffee. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a sandwich? ALEX (SNAPPISHLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry. Jesus. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't even said hello to her. (CONTINUED)
182 CONTINUED: (2) 182 ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with great control), Hello, Gabby. JASON (PROMPTING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Did you miss me, honey?, ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing. Jason gets up from the table. He's wearing workout clothes. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. He walks out of the condo. Alex and Gabriella are left alone together. She jumps in before he can say anything. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just lost his mother, Alex. You can't expect him to act normal. He steps up beside her and moves her hair off her shoulders. ALEX (GENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you try to make him feel better? GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right back at him) Yes. I gave him sonlething to eat. She walks out and up the stairs to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex comes into the room. She's sitting on the bed. GABRIELLA (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I feel like I made her die. Alex sits down beside her and takes her hand. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted her to go away so bad... I used to wish she'd die. And then she did. He lets go of her hand. (CONTINUED)
183 183 CONTINUED: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh,. please. I don't need two children in the house. (noticing her mouth) -- What happened to your mouth? Gabriella's hand jumps to her lip. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. -I bit my lip. He takes her lip between his and nuzzles it. ALEX (TENDERLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? Here?... Better? She tries to laugh and nods. He holds her close. ALEX (CONVERSATIONALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where'd Jason go? 184

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is working out alone in the little gym when in the mirror he sees Alex come through the door. He keeps lifting. Alex sits down on the bench beside him. Jason ignores him. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have something that belongs to .me, Jason -- and I want it back. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not yours. ALEX (HARDER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way. Jason continues to lift. Finally: JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know the thing's worth over a million dollars? What a fucking stupid way to spend money. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was holding it for someone. These are dangerous people. (CONTINUED)
184 184 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar wobbles with Jason's laugh.. Alex moves behind an spots him, unnecessarily. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't screw around with me, Jason. He's in a position to crush Jason's windpipe. Jason shoves the barbell up in his face, finishing the set and re-racking. He reaches for his towel and wipes his face, his expression hidden. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where it is anymore. You killed the only person who did. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident! What did I have to do with it? Jason wads up his towel and throws it at Alex. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a car following us! ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see who was in it? Jason shakes his head no. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met one of these guys. Tall, weird-looking fucker with.a gray crew-cut. (letting out a breath) These people you don't steal from. Whoever was following Suzanne is going to come after you, too. Haven't you figured that out? For the first time Jason wavers.; it's a plausible alternative, but one that makes him guilty instead. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are they? Alex fastidiously drops the towel in the hamper. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. Give the necklace back to me, and we'll split the handling commission. His ingratiating smile offends Jason. He doesn't trust Alex. He shakes his head. (CONTINUED)
184 184 CONTINUED: (2) JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never told me where she kept it. Alex doesn't believe him either. His hand. rests on a dumbbell, and for a murderous instant he's about to pick it up and use it on Jason. He lifts his hand away. 185

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor is lying on his bed, the respirator beside him, while he talks on the phone to Alex. He looks dreadful. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice boy like that, the money means diddlyshit. And, personally, I suspect he'd rather die than tell you. So get a blowtorch, and use it on the girl until he cooperates. 186

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex sits hunched over the desk, the phone in his hand, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: .. Just as an example, Alex. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna make a move.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: When he does, I'll be there. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He hangs up and rocks back in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor attaches his mask, breathes in oxygen. He turns off the light. His breathing deepens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella has already gone to bed. The lights are off. Alex slides into bed beside her with a soft groan. He reaches for her comfort. (CONTINUED)
188 188 CONTINUED: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled against her SKIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm never leaving you again. He starts to caress her. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm already asleep, honey. ALEX (LIGHTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up. She realizes he isn't going away. She rolls onto her back. Her arms go around him.- Alex kisses her, long and deep. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he hear us? Alex's tone turns. Jason is causing him another problem. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's probably figured out why we sleep in the same bed, Gabby. Г‚ВЂВў GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He misses his mother. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So do I. Gabriella props herself up on her elbow. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? ALEX . I wish she was alive and happy and someplace else. Gabriella lies down again and makes herself comfortable against him. He tries again to interest her body. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to go somewhere, just us. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm buying a vineyard in France. Have you ever been to Paris? (CONTINUED)
188 CONTINUED: (2) 188

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rolls onto her stomach, indirectly blocking his frontal exploration. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Alex scoots down next to her, his hand takes possession o her ass. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll stay at the Ritz, we'll eat our way through every three-star restaurant in town -- a new dress every night -- would you like that? Gabriella laughs in wonder and turns onto her side to fac him. They fit themselves together like an old married couple. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting caught up in his own fantasy) -- We'll drive down through Burgundy -- follow the Rhone into Provence, wind up on the Riviera -- Monte Carlo -- GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Princess Stephanie. He gives a rueful laugh; she's younger than he easily remembers. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have tables at the casino where you play baccarat and the bets start at a hundred bucks. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a chuckle) You won't be able to afford it. You'll have spent all your money on my clothes and my jewelry. (slipping her leg BETWEEN HIS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohl Remember Dina's necklace? Alex's eyes go cold and watchful, although she doesn't notice. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. (CONTINUED)
188 188 CONTINUED: (3) GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wear something like that and then if you lose you can throw it on the table to cover your bet, like James Bond. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James had an expense account. He rolls onto his back, she lays her cheek on his graying chest. He no longer wants to make love. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What made you think of the necklace? She's drifting toward sleep. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked good in it, didn't I? He pats her shoulder without answering. He won't sleep for a while. 189

dialogues.speaker: A SEA GULL
dialogues.text: flaps away with a SCREECH that startles us. 190

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason. is walking along the docks. He turns suddenly. Victor melts into the doorway of a shed, but not before Jason has glimpsed him. Jason walks faster. A couple of Fishermen he knows call out greetings. He hops onto a docked boat. 191

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason jumps from boat to boat. He pushes them apart so he can't be followed. 192

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he leaps ashore again, he has shaken Victor. Or so it seems. 193

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella answers the phone. (CONTINUED)
193 193 CONTINUED: GABRIELLA HELLO -- 194

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason'son a pay phone. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) -- Come meet me, I gotta talk to you. I'm at the Haitian marketplace. You know where it is?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIELLA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I can't just -- what am I going to tell him. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An thing you want. Don't drive, take a cab -- (as she laughs at what sounds like silliness) -- I'll wait for you. Jason hangs up. He looks around. He doesn't see Victor watching from the trinket stand. Be walks to the counter where he has already ordered coffee and pie. He picks up his fork. He can't eat. There's a folded newspaper left behind by another customer. He pulls it over. WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Refill, hon? He doesn't even hear her. 195

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella goes out the door. 196

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foot up on the lowest crossbar of the balcony railing, Alex leans on his crossed arms and watches her step into a cab. He's pleased. HIS POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella waves to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella walks through the stalls, looking for Jason and spies him at the counter. The paper is folded beside him. She sits down next to him. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Here I am. What is it? Do you know how much a cab costs? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a guy following me... I thought you weren't safe. I was going to tell you to go stay at your COUSIN'S --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to swivel off the stool to leave. He grabs her hand. JASON (HARDER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Hey! GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sick of this. You'd say anything! He hands her the newspaper. GABRIELLA WHAT -- JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the bottom of the page reads, "Duchess of Windsor Jewels/Stolen From Socialite," with a picture of the Duchess herself in her glory days, necklace around her throat. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reads the headline and starts to laugh. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is such a thing as justicel Dina's necklace. Couldn't happen to a better person. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex stole it. (CONTINUED)
198 198 CONTINUED: GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really hate him. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I know is because I stole it from him. Her eyes widen. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: his face concealed among the candles is trying to figure out what drama is going on between Jason and Gabriella. He can read their faces, but not their lips.

dialogues.speaker: JASON AND GABRIELLA
dialogues.text: GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The sonofabitch. That's why he went out with me. He was trying to use me! (the thought hits her) They'll think I'm part of it! The maid who got fired?? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't a maid. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What difference does it make?? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to the Gulf. He throws money down for the check. 199

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason guns the motorcycle into the street, Gabriella hold him tight. Victor's car merges into traffic several cars behind them (TRAVELING) 200

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: victor is enjoying himself a bit. He fiddles with the RADIO, finds MUSIC he likes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RADIO MUSIC playing, Victor weaves through traffic. He keeps the motorcycle in sight. 202

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason checks in his mirrors.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MIRROR-
dialogues.text: He catches sight of victor's car, the same one that was following his mother. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: accelerates. Gabriella nuzzles his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor makes a face; he thinks he has been spotted. Jason is getting harder to follow. The music ends; An ANNOUNCER describes what it was, gives the time. There's a BEEP. The NEWS THEME starts up. "On the hour every hour, we give you all the news you need..." The announcer continues with the lead stories, including the recently- discovered jewel theft. 204

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason jams the motorcycle TOWARD us, PAST us. Behind, Victor's car suddenly squeals through a U-turn. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shutters have been closed, Alex is lying on the couch in the dark, having a nap. He's awakened by a nasty wheeze. Victor is standing over him. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man with your breeding usually rings the doorbell. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was, is, no time. (CONTINUED)
205 CONTINUED: 205 ALEX (SITTING UP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the news. Victor pulls one of Alex's golf clubs out of the bag as though to admire it. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you keep money here somewhere. (A BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your stash. Give it to me. Alex spreads out his hands. AALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vic, Vic -- The golf club catches him in the midsection. Alex cries out. The blow folds him forward onto his knees. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The. cops are about to drive up your street. He brings the club down on Alex's bare foot. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through teeth clenched WITH PAIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing here to.give you. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it? He clips Alex on the other leg as he tries to crawl away. The physical effort shortens Victor's breathing. His cough sprays blood. He tightens his grip on the club. ALEX "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me -- I swear to God, I DON'T --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor raises the club over Alex's head, and brings it down on the coffee table instead. The glass-explodes. He has to push the words out through aГўВЂВўcoughing spasm. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I refuse to die in a fucking prison clinic! Alex staggers to his feet. Victor is struggling for breath. Alex jerks the golf club away from him and tosses it on the floor. (CONTINUED)
205 205 CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arm around victor's waist and helps him to th sofa. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, this is pitiful. Victor drops onto the sofa. He gags on the blood in his throat and desperately draws in air. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a mess. He picks up a sofa pillow to arrange it for him. Victor gives him a grateful smile. Alex presses the pillow down over his face before he can react. His feet flail. Alex has to lie on top of him to hold him down. A couple making out on the couch. The GUN THUMPS to the floor. Victor's movements slow, and stop. Alex takes no chances. He keeps the pillow jammed down until there's no possibility of trickery. Satisfied, he rolls Victor's dead body onto the floor, steps over it, and with steady hands he opens a bottle of very expensive wine. He pours a glass. ALEX (QUIETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you got to die in your own clothes, Vic. That's something. 206

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few Truckers make remarks as Gabriella walks toward the bank of phones. "Hey, pretty lady." "Possibility?" "She's not your type." She doesn't mind swinging her hips a little for their benefit. 207

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE is RINGING. Alex sits in a chair in the dark. Then he crosses to the phone, picks it up and waits for the caller to speak. 208

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella is watching for Jason. INTERCUT as needed. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) I'm with him. (CONTINUED)     208 208 CONTINUED: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What took you so long. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a boat, Alex! It's on the boat. The dumb shit wants to turn it over to the cops. You know what'll happen to me. Alex is taking his passport out of his desk. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me how to find you. He opens another drawer. There's a gun inside. 209

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason comes out of the men's room. He doesn't see Gabriella for a moment. A couple of truckers block his view. Now he catches sight of her. She's coming from the direction of the phones, a can of soda in her hand. Their eyes meet. She smiles and waves the can, hurries to meet h1m. 210

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcycle cruises up the coast road. The surf glows with plankton. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: presses her cheek against Jason's back. 211

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason secures the motorcycle. He puts his arm around Gabriella, they walk down the dock to his boat. He helps her aboard. JASON (CALLING OUT) HENRY --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry emerges from the cabin. He eyes Gabriella. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my. (CONTINUED)
211 211 CONTINUED: JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Gabriella. She's my contraband. She looks quickly at Jason, who smiles. Henry reaches out to shake her hand. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid's a sucker for dark skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriella and Jason tenderly make love in the swaying cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On watch, Henry finds his gaze sliding to the NOISY dockside BAR, its beer sign beacon-bright. The SOUNDS BELOW embarrass him. He makes up his mind. He swings off the boat and heads toward the bar. He doesn't notice Alex's Cadillac idling in the alley. The headlights click off, the motor goes silent. The BOATS CREAK against the slips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason wakes up with a start. He senses something. He slides out from under the sleeping weight of Gabriella's arm and pulls on his jeans, reaches up to open the cabin hatch. HIS POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex's foot swinging. More of him comes INTO SIGHT as Jason climbs to deck. The financial pages open on his lap, he's drinking a Styrofoam cup of coffee and eating a donut; the rest of the bag of donuts is next to him. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning! I brought donuts. Jason is struck silent. He sits down on the side of the boat, his arms around his ribs. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's not as bad as all that. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fucking called you. (CONTINUED)
214 214 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex shrugs. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has some residual loyalty, yeah. (MODESTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which I didn't expect either. Jason moves to the helm, switches on the engine. Alex quickly finishes his donut. He brushes off his fingers. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going fishing. Get off if you want. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's a beautiful day for a boat ride. Give us a chance to talk. He makes himself comfortable. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then make yourself useful and cast off the stern line. Alex moves to the stern while Jason casts off the bow line. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
