dialogues.text: There's not a lot of choice. Alex casts off. Jason backs the-boat into position. He sees Henry asleep in the doorway of the marine supplies store next to the shuttered bar. Alex rejoins him. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- If we could manage to ignore the personal history here, I think we could work something out between us. Jason turns the boat toward the open sea. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want Gabriella? This is the way to have her. Life costs, Jason. Love costs. And you love her more than I do. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
214 214 CONTINUED: (2) ALEX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Jason glances at HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So stake yourself to a life together. Give her what she needs -- (SEEING GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: before Jason does) -- Hi, honey. Gabriella comes up onto deck. She glances bewildered at the ocean around them. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we -- JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Shut up! Just shut up! She sits on the bench, her face tight and angry. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's feeling like you let him down. .She gives Alex a look that silences him. He reaches for another donut. The SOUNDS of the ENGINE and the HULL hitting the waves substitute for conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason finishes setting the lines. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Okay. I'm ready to listen. He sits down beside a pole and looks over at Gabriella, who has put on a hat. She's staring out to sea. JASON (TO GABRIELLA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex wants to make me an offer. She gives no sign of having heard him. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're giving you a hard choice, Gabby. Two rich men. Gabriella swivels her head slowly. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want either one of you. A line quivers. Jason reels in a little. (CONTINUED)
215 215 CONTINUED: JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's going to bite, just ABOUT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his biceps tightening) -- now. And the bait is taken at the moment he said. The line reels out very, very fast. He lets the fish run with it. Gabriella has turned around to watch. Now Jason reels in a little, making the line taut, testing the weight. He yanks back. The line rises from the ocean, bringing to the surface a big, dark green fish. _ ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! What the hell is that? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammerhead. Young. Male. Jason plays the shark until it's close to the boat and thrashing for its life. Gabriella's scared. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help him, Alex. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just get in his way. His hand comes to rest on her shoulder as Jason expertly reels in the bucking hammerhead. She shrugs away from his hand. Jason has hooked a ten-foot, three-finned sea beast with a spade-shaped head and black eyes on each side. He attaches the line to a winch and winds it up onto the deck. It twists wildly, knocking things over until it slows down and finally lies very still. His chest heaving with the effort, Jason looks around. Alex has disappeared without either of them noticing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is searching frantically.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No luck? Alex whirls around. His gun materializes in his hand. Jason retreats a step. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your backup plan? (CONTINUED)
216 216 CONTINUED: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want it so bad, it's yours. He pulls out the necklace and hurls it away from Alex. ALEX (MOANING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little prick. 217

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: skitters along the deck. The shark's body stops it from dropping out the open gate in the transom. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: scrambles toward the necklace. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him have it! He'll kill USL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason grabs her-and holds her with both arms to keep her from going any closer. Alex turns his head, puzzled, warned. Too late. The shark suddenly thrashes, its jaws snapping around him. Gabriella screams with Alex. He FIRES his GUN over and over until it's empty. The shark continues to tear at him. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, help.mel! Gabriella runs down into the cabin. Much as he hates Alex, Jason can't let him die. like this. He charges. forward and straddles the shark, jams the blade of his knife into the primordial brain. He twists the handle once. The shark dies instantly. Trembling with adrenalin, Jason gets off its back. With his elbows Alex drags himself out of the jaws. He's badly mangled.. The shark slowly changes color to a dull brown. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew it wasn't dead. Jason squats down beside him to access his injuries. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom didn't take the necklace. did. (CONTINUED)
217 CONTINUED: 217

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex struggles to stay conscious. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you killed her yourself. Jason slowly nods. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you were in the car behind us. Gabriella drops down beside them. She has a flare gun, no longer needed, and sheets from the cabin to stop the bleeding. She starts to tear them up. She's crying slightly. GABRIELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were supposed to turn him ini I didn't think you were going to kill him! JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't. Alex manages to laugh. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. You set me up. You had her call me. (TO GABRIELLA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... I believed you. Jason pushes to his feet and heads for the cockpit. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get on the radio. Gabriella wraps the strips of sheet tightly around what's left of Alex to bandage. She smears away the tears so she can see and leaves blood tracked across her face. She looks down to see his bloody hand clutching the necklace. They look at each other. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: has the microphone in his hand. He's setting course. Gabriella appears behind him. She's holding the flare gun. She puts it back where she found it, and steps beside him and puts her arm around his waist. He lays his arm over her shoulders and holds her close while he uses the radio. JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Hercules II, calling the Harbormaster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat heads back to port. 219

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At an unused pier Gabriella leans back against the line t hold the boat in place. Henry and Jason carry Alex off the boat and lay him on the planks. SIRENS can be faintly heard. Jason leaps back on the boat. Henry pushes them off. CLOSER ANGLE HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cool? JASON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya. He and Jason wave goodbye. The boat moves out. Henry is left with Alex. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly; to Henry) What's your name? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way -- ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still the salesman) -- No, listen, listen -- this is worth a fortune. (thrusting the necklace TOWARD HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play the possibilities. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Good advice. And he walks away fast. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, don't go! Come back here. Come on back! Henry's gone. Alex rolls onto his belly and starts dragging himself down the dock, too much of an optimist t give up hope in a hopeless situation.
